stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes the conditions under which  methodX  and  methodY  return the same value?

features.html:
Consider the following methods.

 

  • /** Preconditions: a > 0 and b > 0 */
public static int methodX(int a, int b)
{
   int loopCount = 0;
   for (int i = 0; i < a / b; i++)
   {
      loopCount++;
   }
   return loopCount;
}

  •  

  • /** Preconditions: a > 0 and b > 0 */
public static int methodY(int a, int b)
{
   int loopCount = 0;
   int i = 0;
   while (i < a)
   {
      loopCount++;
      i += b;
   }
   return loopCount;
}

choicesHtml: When  a  and  b  are both even
When  a  and  b  are both odd
When  a % b  is equal to zero
When  a % b  is equal to one
